intro: Orthodon punctulatus, commonly known as the spotted orthodon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers with a central disc and ray florets. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Orthodon punctulatus is often found in temperate regions and is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
